column4: So, I couldnt find anything on the help pages... In the audio settings, I selected my External sound card as the default one. But XMMS (for example) plays sound on my internal Laptop speakers. (Selected ALSA in XMMS settings with default audio autput device). If i select OOS, sound comes from my external card but then no other app can play sound to that device. I tried every possible configuration but i cant get all apps to play sound over
m1r,what about mount?
if you change your sound devide to oss you'll need to change the sound device in your apps as well , but I think gnome native apps should see the change whithout help,( like gnome and rythmbox)
I block /msg you'll need to talk to me in the channel
I want to use ALSA (not OOS) but i cant get ALSA to play sound on my external card
did you try chaning the card in alsamixer ? type alsamixer in the terminal
check in the forum for a way to set a alsamixer to use a different card then
that's the most I can do for you
you'll need to rested your sound thingy to use alsa
I need to do what?
where did you change from alsa to oss the last time ?
let me get this straight,  you are trying to use a usb sound card ????
have you looked up the card model and number in the forum ?
disable your onboard soundcard in the bios ? if you can ?
www.ubuntuforums.org
best of luck
yes I recall, I told you to find a way to redirecting alsa to your other card
sorry, but I realy donT' know how to go about fixing it,  did you check the card model in the forum ?
it's always a better idea to search the forum
google is also a good place not everything linux is in the ubuntuforums
do you know a way to disable OSS?
I don'T , check in the forum  , I'm sorry but I am lowsy with hardware problems
